net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing
Class MetricSpacesInvertedListIndexing

java.lang.Object
  net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing.MetricSpacesInvertedListIndexing

public class MetricSpacesInvertedListIndexing
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides an indexing approach for approximate search based on the work of G. Amato (giuseppe.amato@isti.cnr.it). See also his paper "Approximate Similarity Search in Metric Spaces using Inverted Files" Date: 14.05.2009 Time: 14:22:03

Author:
Mathias Lux, mathias@juggle.at

Method Detail

getDefaultInstance

public static MetricSpacesInvertedListIndexing getDefaultInstance()

createIndex

public void createIndex(java.lang.String indexPath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Creates a set of reference objects and stores it in a new index (name "-ro"). Then creates ordered lists of reference object positions for each data item in the index with given feature. Finally a new index (name "-ms") is created where all the original documents as well as the new data are stored.

Parameters:
indexPath - the path to the original index
Throws:
java.io.IOException

updateIndex

public void updateIndex(java.lang.String indexPath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
We assume that the initial indexing has been done and a set of reference objects has been found and indexed in the sepaarete directory. However further documents were added and they now need to get a ranked list of reference objects. So we (i) get all these new documents missing the field "ro-order" and (ii) add this field.

Parameters:
indexPath - the index to update
Throws:
java.io.IOException
